thread.title: Rams place franchise tag on Trumaine Johnson for $16.7M next season
thread.title_full: Rams place franchise tag on Trumaine Johnson for $16.7M next season

title: Rams place franchise tag on Trumaine Johnson for $16.7M next season
text:
Rams place franchise tag on Trumaine Johnson for $16.7M next season Rams place franchise tag on Trumaine Johnson for $16.7M next season By Tanya Ray Fox 13 hours ago 32 shares By: Tanya Ray Fox | 13 hours ago 
The Los Angeles Rams have placed the franchise tag on top free agent cornerback Trumaine Johnson, per Adam Schefter. Rams placed franchise tag on CB Trumaine Johnson, per source. Another player tagged before today's 4 pm deadline. 
— Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) March 1, 2017 
As perhaps the best player at his position on the market, Johnson was too expensive for the Rams to sign to a long-term deal, prompting them to use exercise the franchise tag option on him for the second season in a row. Related: Eric Berry shows Trumaine Johnson, T.J. McDonald could get overpaid 
The tag comes with a 20 percent increase over last year’s nearly $14 million, which means the 27-year-old defensive back will make about $16.7 million this year. 
Had he hit the market, Johnson could have been looking at a significant deal. Spotrac listed his calculated market value for a four-years at $49,636,571, or $12.4 million annually. Related: Rams cornerback Trumaine Johnson is a Top 25 free agent this offseason 
The tag makes it clear that the Rams are going all in on defense this year, presumably with the knowledge that the unit will have to sustain them as they work out the various kinks and limitations on offense. 
The defensive line is in great shape with Aaron Donald, William Hayes, Robert Quinn, linebacker Alec Ogletree and former safety-turned-linebacker Mark Barron. 
Maintaining Johnson in the secondary means the Rams have a real shot at putting together an elite unit under Wade Phillips in 2017. More wade phillips!
